ThingDef.label: Frontier Officer Uniform
ThingDef.description: Distinction is an important aspect of an army, from the hero of the ancient world to the home-grown heroes. This uniform serves as a symbol of that distinction, a heavy coat designed with comfort and protection in mind, comfortable in both hot and cold though costly to produce. Such was the case for the Great Domain that this uniform is rarely seen outside of professional armies, often in the hands of remnant armies of the Great Domain. Though its rarity does not prohibit its usage, it is still found even among the most remote worlds of the Rim.

li.loreDesc: Distinction is an important aspect of an army, from the hero of the ancient world to the home-grown heroes. This uniform serves as a symbol of that distinction, a heavy coat designed with comfort and protection in mind, comfortable in both hot and cold though costly to produce. Such was the case for the Great Domain that this uniform is rarely seen outside of professional armies, often in the hands of remnant armies of the Great Domain. Though its rarity does not prohibit its usage, it is still found even among the most remote worlds of the Rim.
li.vanillaDesc: Tailored officer variant of the frontier uniform. Provides the same light protection and mobility as the standard set with refined cut and rank insignia. Balanced insulation for temperate conditions.

ThingDef.label: Frontier Officer Uniform (Polar)
ThingDef.description: While the Officer Uniform is a strong contender for a perfect uniform for the Rim, it has come up short in one aspect, the cold. In polar environments the Officer uniform fails to maintain a warm temperature for the wearer. The solution was simple, a modified form of the mesh heating network found in the Polar Uniforms that now functions off a kinetic battery which was more effective due to the layers of the uniform. Though issues have still arisen with this variant, many prefer faulty item that can work rather than hoping for something else to keep them warm.

li.loreDesc: While the Officer Uniform is a strong contender for a perfect uniform for the Rim, it has come up short in one aspect, the cold. In polar environments the Officer uniform fails to maintain a warm temperature for the wearer. The solution was simple, a modified form of the mesh heating network found in the Polar Uniforms that now functions off a kinetic battery which was more effective due to the layers of the uniform. Though issues have still arisen with this variant, many prefer faulty item that can work rather than hoping for something else to keep them warm.
li.vanillaDesc: Officer variant built for polar service. Heavy insulated composition and a windproof shell retain warmth in severe cold. Same light protection as the officer uniform, optimized for extreme climates.

ThingDef.label: Officer Cap
ThingDef.description: Based on an Old Earth symbol of authority, this headwear was said to exude an air of authority over ones subordinates. Its ability to drawn a stronger response from soldiers has not been measured though some still see it as a true sign of authority and power. Though many of it’s wearers also have mentioned the lack of warmth from it and the discomfort of the tight headband.

li.loreDesc: Based on an Old Earth symbol of authority, this headwear was said to exude an air of authority over ones subordinates. Its ability to drawn a stronger response from soldiers has not been measured though some still see it as a true sign of authority and power. Though many of it’s wearers also have mentioned the lack of warmth from it and the discomfort of the tight headband.
li.vanillaDesc: Tailored headwear for frontier officers. Provides modest protection and insulation while displaying rank insignia. Balanced composition makes it suitable for most environments.

ThingDef.label: Officer Cap (Polar)
ThingDef.description: The traditional tailored headwear for an officer. Modified to have thermal materials to surround the head and maintain warmth even in the coldest environments. A balanced approach to both maintaining comfort and displaying of ones rank.

li.loreDesc: Though a symbol of Old Earth authority, keeping your nose and ears attached to your head is a great start. This features a modified mesh heating network as the common polar weather gear, maintaining the user is a consistent state of warmth. Though used by an officer it still functions with bio-checmical reactions using the shed hair and dead skin cells of the user. While many would consider it uncouth, it is either maintaining class with a frostbitten nose or staying warm in the mesh oven around your head.
li.vanillaDesc: The traditional tailored headwear for an officer. Modified to have thermal materials to surround the head and maintain warmth even in the coldest environments. A balanced approach to both maintaining comfort and displaying of ones rank.
